tool.name: hicBuildMatrix
tool.command:
hicBuildMatrix
--samFiles #for $repeat in $samFiles: ${repeat.samFile} #end for
#if $binSize and $binSize is not None: --binSize $binSize #end if
#if $fragmentLength and $fragmentLength is not None: --fragmentLength $fragmentLength #end if
#if $restrictionCutFile and $restrictionCutFile is not None: --restrictionCutFile $restrictionCutFile #end if
#if $minDistance and $minDistance is not None: --minDistance $minDistance #end if
#if $maxDistance and $maxDistance is not None: --maxDistance $maxDistance #end if
#if $restrictionSequence and $restrictionSequence is not None: --restrictionSequence $restrictionSequence #end if
#if $region and $region is not None: --region $region #end if
--outFileName ./numpy_array.npz --outBam ./unsorted.bam &&
samtools sort ./unsorted.bam sorted

param.name: binSize
param.label: Bin size in bp
param.help: If used, the restriction cut places (if given) are used to only consider reads that are in the vicinity of the resctriction sites. Otherwise all reads in the interval are considered.

param.name: restrictionCutFile
param.label: BED file with all restriction cut places
param.help: Should contaion only mappable restriction sites. If given, the bins are set to match the restriction fragments (i.e. the region between one restriction site and the next).

param.name: minDistance
param.label: Minimum distance between restriction sites
param.help: Restriction sites that are closer that this distance are merged into one. This option only applies if --restrictionCutFile is given.

param.name: maxDistance
param.label: Maximum distance in bp from restriction site to read, to consider a read a valid one
param.help: This option only applies if --restrictionCutFile is given.

param.name: restrictionSequence
param.label: Sequence of the restriction site
param.help: This is used to discard reads that end/start with such sequence and that are considered un-ligated fragments or "dangling-ends". If not given, such statistics will not be available.

param.name: region
param.label: Region of the genome to limit the operation
param.help: The format is chr:start-end. Also valid is just to specify a chromosome, for example chr10

tool.help:
**What it does**
Creates a matrix of interactions
